comments.author: blockman
comments.body: Quote from: kilopi239 on August 07, 2023, 01:50:15 AMMay I know your thoughts about Near Protocol and Harmony ONE?    Not that much that I hear both of them but it looks like they're still at the top ranks. Since I don't hold any of them, the best thing for you to start with if you wanna believe on these projects is to look at their websites. From there, you'll get a glimpse of what these projects are all about and what they're working on. Honestly, with that way of checking these projects, I think that near has got some good things about its progress. But that doesn't mean you should invest already on it. Look at many markets where it has been and how they're doing as a project and progress that they've been working with. If you think that if all of those points are found in any of them, then start thinking whether to buy or not. It's not just all about the hype or what not but it's all about what you know about the project so that you're not naive upon buying it.

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: What exactly are you interested in? I can say that these are not the most popular protocols and the projects that developers deploy in these networks are not characterized by any high level of distribution in various crypto services. If these networks do not have any clear advantages over others, I do not see much point in using them. The native tokens of these protocols also indicate a low demand for such blockchain spaces.
